metadata.description: Speckit codifies platform governance with developer-native workflows, policy gates, and continuous evidence.

footer.description: Speckit orchestrates the spec-to-release loop with programmable policy gates and continuous evidence.

hero.title: End vibe‑coding. One spec → compliant releases.
hero.description: Speckit makes one governed spec the source of truth for policy gates, approvals, and evidence so regulated releases ship with audit-ready proof.

features.title: Governed spec loop
features.description: Model architecture decisions, risk reviews, and policy checks in a living spec that maps to every commit.

features.title: Policy gates
features.description: Codify approvals across CI/CD, infrastructure, and runtime with reusable controls and transparent history.

features.title: Continuous evidence
features.description: Generate SBOMs, attestations, and RTMs automatically so audits, customer reviews, and leadership updates are no-drama.

workflows.title: Speckit centralizes governance without slowing flow
workflows.description: Replace spreadsheets, ad hoc approvals, and one-off attestations. Speckit codifies governance into developer workflows, then feeds evidence to the people and systems that need it.

items.name: Risk-aware release approvals
items.description: Dynamic checklists tied to spec changes, risk posture, and policy owners.

items.name: Supply chain attestation
items.description: SLSA-aligned attestations from source to deploy, with artifact lineage graphing.

items.name: Control reporting
items.description: Real-time dashboards for SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and FedRAMP evidence gaps.

checklist: ✔ Security controls verified against CIS profiles

alignment.title: All teams see the same source of truth
alignment.description: Platform, security, compliance, and product leaders collaborate in a shared context. Speckit syncs with GitHub, Jira, ServiceNow, and Supabase so your data stays where work already happens.

cards.title: Spec-first workflows
cards.description: Tie every requirement to implementation and validation in one place.

cards.title: Compliance-ready APIs
cards.description: Push evidence to GRC suites, customer trust portals, and ticketing systems.

cards.title: Shared Supabase core
cards.description: Marketing and product leads flow into one RLS-protected Supabase dataset.

cards.title: Developer-native UX
cards.description: CLI, GitHub Actions, and APIs that meet engineers in their existing workflows.

hero.title: Pick the plan that matches your governance journey
hero.description: All plans include the shared Supabase data core, policy orchestration engine, and evidence APIs.

hero.title: One platform to model, enforce, and prove governance
hero.description: Speckit connects planning, delivery, and assurance. Ship faster with guardrails that satisfy platform, security, and compliance leaders.

pillars.title: Model
pillars.description: Capture architecture decisions, risks, and policy owners in collaborative specs synced to Git.

pillars.title: Enforce
pillars.description: Apply reusable controls across pipelines, cloud, and service catalogs with explainable results.

pillars.title: Prove
pillars.description: Generate and distribute evidence to auditors, customers, and leadership automatically.

steps.name: Spec kickoff
steps.description: Start with a versioned spec linked to code. Assign approvers and risk posture.

steps.name: Policy orchestration
steps.description: Controls run across CI, IaC, and runtime. Exceptions are documented and routed for review.

steps.name: Evidence stream
steps.description: SBOMs, attestations, and control proofs sync to Supabase, GRC tools, and customer portals.

integrationsCard.title: Integrations that meet you where you work
integrationsCard.description: Use Speckit UI, CLI, or APIs. Bring your own secrets manager, ticketing, and observability stack.

supabaseCard.title: Shared Supabase data core
paragraphs: Marketing and product forms feed one Supabase project. Row-level security keeps leads private while your GTM and product teams analyze performance.
Use the service role to sync Speckit evidence to your data warehouse or customer trust portal with confidence.

hero.title: A continuous loop that brings trust into daily delivery
hero.description: Speckit unites planning, shipping, and proving. Every step is automated, traceable, and designed for collaboration.

stages.name: Capture
stages.description: Specs start in Git-backed docs. Risk, controls, and approvers are defined at the beginning, not the end.

stages.name: Orchestrate
stages.description: Controls trigger across pipelines and environments. Exceptions kick off review workflows automatically.

stages.name: Publish
stages.description: Evidence lands where it is needed — Supabase, GRC tools, customer trust portals, and analytics stacks.

audiences.value: Golden paths with governance built-in. No more waiting for approvals or chasing down sign-offs.
Policy-as-code with transparency. Audit every control execution and exception trail.
Evidence on demand. Dashboards map controls to frameworks and highlight gaps instantly.

tooling.title: Bring your own tooling
tooling.description: Speckit integrates via webhooks, REST APIs, and SDKs. Use our Supabase adapters to sync data across environments with RLS intact.
items: Supabase, Snowflake, and customer trust portals

steps.title: Week 1 — Discovery

steps.title: Weeks 2-3 — Orchestration
steps.description: Configure Supabase, connect repos, and codify policy gates in pipelines and IaC.

steps.title: Weeks 4-5 — Enablement
steps.description: Enable teams with templates, guardrail playbooks, and evidence dashboards.

steps.title: Week 6 — Scale
steps.description: Review KPIs, expand to additional services, and integrate evidence feeds into trust portals.

hero.title: Launch Speckit in four guided commands.
hero.description: Use the afternoon-friendly quickstart to sync the template, generate governance scaffolding, verify policies, and launch the TUI coach.

intro.title: Ship a governed release with the starter workspace
intro.description: You only need Node.js 20+, pnpm, and a GitHub repository. Follow the steps below to model your first spec, wire automation, and capture evidence.

steps.heading: Run the quickstart commands
steps.description: Each command runs from your terminal inside the project directory. Replace placeholder names with your own service or repository.
steps.label: Step {count}

items.title: Initialize the template workspace
items.description: Clone the opinionated Speckit starter so you begin with prewired policies, CI, and documentation structure.

items.title: Generate specs and automation
items.description: Run the generator to sync your spec definitions into pipelines, policy gates, and evidence collectors.

items.title: Verify policies and tests
items.description: Execute the built-in checks to confirm guardrails pass before you open a pull request.

items.title: Coach the rollout with the TUI
items.description: Open the interactive coach to walk policy owners through approvals, evidence, and rollout tasks.
